Detailed Description

Represents a specialized editbox control that shows a label when the control is not focused (and there is no data in the editbox).

This can be used to give UI hints to the user about what to enter into the textbox.

The control also has the ability to add text either by appending it, inserting it or replacing an active selection.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Default constructor which creates a standard editbox control.

Use this when performing "two-step" construction with wxWidgets Create() methods.

Do nothing.

Member Function Documentation

StatusTextCtrl::DECLARE_EVENT_TABLE (  ) 

void StatusTextCtrl::InsertUrl ( const wxString &  url  ) 

Inserts a URL (if it is a valid URL) to the editbox at the current insertion point, replacing any existing selections if there are any.

Note: This method does nothing if the URL is not a valid URL.

Parameters:
url the URL to insert
